subject: Photography
title: Ansel Adams and the Landscape
description: A short lesson to help you apply Ansel Adams and the Landscape.

hook.text: Ansel Adams didn't just photograph mountains. He made America fall in love with its own wilderness.

buildup.text: His black-and-white images of Yosemite and the American West became icons of conservation.

discovery.text: Adams developed the Zone System â€” a method for controlling exposure and development to get perfect tones.

twist.text: His photographs helped convince Congress to establish new national parks. Art became policy.

climax.text: Adams proved that photography could be both technically masterful and deeply emotional.

punchline.text: He saved forests with photographs, not chainsaws.

quiz.question: What was Ansel Adams's lasting impact beyond art?
options: His photos helped establish national parks and conservation
